Package projects.bpt

Class BinaryPatriciaTrie

  • java.lang.Object
    • projects.bpt.BinaryPatriciaTrie
  • public class BinaryPatriciaTrie
extends java.lang.Object

    BinaryPatriciaTrie is a Patricia Trie over the binary alphabet { 0, 1 }. By restricting themselves to this small but terrifically useful alphabet, Binary Patricia Tries combine all the positive aspects of Patricia Tries while shedding the storage cost typically associated with Tries that deal with huge alphabets.

    Author:

      • inorderTraversal

        public java.util.Iterator<java.lang.String> inorderTraversal()

        Performs an inorder (symmetric) traversal of the Binary Patricia Trie. Remember from lecture that inorder traversal in tries is NOT sorted traversal, unless all the stored keys have the same length. This is of course not required by your implementation, so you should make sure that in your tests you are not expecting this method to return keys in lexicographic order. We put this method in the interface because it helps us test your submission thoroughly and it helps you debug your code!

        We neither require nor test whether the Iterator returned by this method is fail-safe or fail-fast. This means that you do not need to test for thrown ConcurrentModificationExceptions and we do not test your code for the possible occurrence of concurrent modifications.

        We also assume that the Iterator is immutable, i,e we do not test for the behavior of Iterator.remove(). You can handle it any way you want for your own application, yet we will not test for it.

        Returns:
        An Iterator over the String keys stored in the trie, exposing the elements in symmetric order.

      • getLongest

        public java.lang.String getLongest()
        Finds the longest String stored in the Binary Patricia Trie.
        Returns:

        The longest String stored in this. If the trie is empty, the empty string "" should be returned. Careful: the empty string ""is not the same string as " "; the latter is a string consisting of a single space character! It is also not the same as the null reference!

        Ties should be broken in terms of value of the bit string. For example, if our trie contained only the binary strings 01 and 11, 11 would be the longest string. If our trie contained only 001 and 010, 010 would be the longest string.

      • isJunkFree

        public boolean isJunkFree()
        Makes sure that your trie doesn't have splitter nodes with a single child. In a Patricia trie, those nodes should be pruned. Be careful with the implementation of this method, since our tests call it to make sure your deletions work correctly! That is to say, if your deletions work well, but you have made an error in this (far easier) method, you will still not be passing our tests!
        Returns:
        true iff all nodes in the trie either denote stored strings or split into two subtrees, false otherwise.
